Also, I had to reset my password and the fields didn’t properly display, so it was hard to tell if I had actually entered characters. In summary, very clunky UI and no access to premium content on the app. Not sure why I shouldn’t just delete from my phone to save space.

title: Personal Information has been Stolen by LinkedIn itself
text:
Subject: Strong Disappointment with LinkedIn's Account Restriction and Data Security

Dear LinkedIn Support,

I am writing to express my deep disappointment and frustration regarding the recent events surrounding my LinkedIn account. After being an active member for 15 years, diligently growing and developing my professional network, I was shocked to discover that my account had been permanently restricted without any explanation provided.

What adds insult to injury is the fact that all the personal information I had painstakingly collected over the course of those 15 years has seemingly been stolen by LinkedIn itself. This egregious violation of trust raises serious concerns about the security of our personal information on the platform.

As a long-time user, I believed that LinkedIn, being a prominent professional networking platform, would prioritize the privacy and security of its members' data. However, this incident has shattered that confidence. It is disheartening to see how such a breach can occur in the United States, where we expect a higher standard of data protection.

What exacerbates the situation is the lack of transparency and communication on LinkedIn's part. Without any details or explanations provided, I am left in the dark, unable to understand the reasoning behind the drastic measures taken against my account. This lack of accountability only further erodes the trust I once had in the platform.

At this point, I can only hope that the individuals responsible for this breach will be identified and brought to justice. It is essential that scammers and wrongdoers face the consequences of their actions. Moreover, I implore LinkedIn to take immediate steps to rectify this situation, not only for me but for all users affected by similar incidents.

I had always considered LinkedIn as a reliable platform for professional purposes, but my experience has left me with no choice but to warn others about the potential risks involved. It is disheartening to see a platform with such potential fail to fulfill its duty in safeguarding its users' information.

I expect a prompt and thorough investigation into this matter, along with a detailed explanation of the actions taken against my account. Additionally, I request that appropriate measures be implemented to prevent such breaches from occurring in the future and to restore faith in the security of our personal information.

Thank you for your attention to this matter. I hope that LinkedIn takes this complaint seriously and works towards resolving the issue to regain the trust of its users.

Sincerely,

I.D

title: Good Platform form for Professionals
text:
I have been using LinkedIn for quite sometime.  I like using LinkedIn for all of my professional contacts, seeing what jobs are available, what trainings are being recommended and what is new with the companies that I follow and my network.  

While I am in the app and finding businesses I want to follow, it would be great if there could be cross-platform of all Meta Platform apps that when I follow a company here, I would automatically be following all of the affiliated pages for that company within all apps on the Meta Platform.  This would allow friends who are on FaceBook but not necessarily already on LinkedIn be able to see on my wall what different company’s are offering since I have ads appearing.  This might entice them to either checkout a training class or product that they might not necessarily have known about along with eliminate me from missing a cross post to the other platform.  

I notice that company’s I am following are also available in my Amazon platform.  Since Amazon is also on the Meta Platform, it would be easier for me if not only when I follow the company on LinkedIn that the follow also attaches to all other applications including Amazon on the Meta Platform.  

Thank you!

Nicole Endy

title: Poor customer support
text: Nonexistent customer support. Had an account for almost 10 years that was suspended due to my account first name not matching my legal name. I have gone by a nickname my whole life but apparently this is not ok on this app even though both names were on my resume that was on my profile. Tried to appeal but was denied due to name not matching the name on my ID.

title: Ok, but problems with Premium
text:
The app is ok to use and helpful for finding and posting jobs. They need more options for submitting incorrect job postings. I can’t tell you how many are marked as remote when they’re actually hybrid and the actual location is nowhere near the posted location. 

I also find the cost of their Premium service to be way too expensive for the limited benefit you receive from it. They have also made it to where you cannot cancel from the app or your cellphone’s browser. You have to cancel from a desktop computer browser. What if you are someone who has lost their job, doesn’t have a personal computer at home, can’t afford the $40+/month, and you can’t cancel the subscription from your phone? I think a complaint to the BBB is in order.

Scrolling so slow and choppy and makes viewing any page or feed difficult.

title: Best. App. Ever.
text: LinkedIn is one of my all time favorite apps. I’m an entrepreneur and I really enjoy talking to the LinkedIn community and sharing great business advice!

title: Suggested posts
text: Stop shoving suggested posts to my feed. I follow specific people for a reason. I do not want to see three suggested posts that I do not care about in between posts of people I actually follow. Makes me not even want to scroll through the feed. If anything do it like instagram where if you scroll through the new posts of people you follow thats when the suggested posts go in.

title: Premium is a Joke
text:
I’ve used LinkedIn for a while now from a personal career growth perspective. Overall the app works well, I enjoy the layout (for the most part), and have had a few great experiences. 
However, all of that is negated by the simple fact that there is NO contact for customer support unless you have premium.

There’s no number to call for help, and if you search for one, they have a notice stating all lines pretending to be LinkedIn are a scam and they’re working to eradicate them. But… you could also just have a legitimate help-line yourself.

This app is supposed to be used for a number of professional purposes, but the sole focus for most people is finding a job. $40 a month for a service that.. at it’s core function, does what?… Helps people find a job so they can make money? How is that justifiable? Anyone using an app, regardless of funds, should be entitled to basic customer service. It’s how literally every other app operates. The fact that this one, the one that’s supposed to help you out of financial trouble, doesn’t… is morally reprehensible.

title: APPLY ON THE COMPANY WEBSITE
text:
I am not confident that when I apply for a job through LinkedIn that my application actually goes anywhere. I suggest saving the job and applying on the company website.

Also, I am constantly contacted by recruiters who have clearly not viewed my profile, and contact me about roles that I am already in or overqualified for. If it clearly says in my profile that my current role is a “Senior Analyst,” why do you think I would be interested in an entry level “Analyst” role? This is happens CONSTANTLY, and is very discouraging during a job search. I would like this to stop happening. Please require recruiters to actually view your profiles before contacting potential applicants.

title: A bug when click on “view profile” tab
text: There’s a bug/issue when clicking on “ view profile” tab, it’s crashing and getting me out of the app.

title: It has potential
text:
LinkedIn is 5 stars when it comes to your profile and networking options.  However, the job search feature needs work.  The filters do not work very.  For example, I always select the “on-site” and “hybrid” options for locations, and yet I will get job after job that is “remote” even though I have purposely not chosen that as an option.  The website has the same issue if you try to use it on a PC.

The site is also buggy from the employers side.  My team has tried multiple times to post a job and I have received the same error claiming that there is an issue with my email.  The app/website support is poor and I have not been able to successfully contact them.  

LinkedIn could make every other platform irrelevant if they could just improve their job search engine.

text:

title: Forced update with bad version detection
text:
Linked in is forcing me to update. OK, fine.

Popup:  “This update requires (something my phone can’t have), would you like to use the last supported version?”  (click download) 
Goes back to the first popup…

“This update requires (something my phone can’t have), would you like to use the last supported version?”  (I click download again) 
Goes back to the first popup…  

Infinite repeat.

Hey LinkedIn devs, care to fix this loop?

title: Download the app and never use the website again or else

Even if you select the option that you don’t have access to that device and that you want a text or email it will STILL not allow you to reset your password or login. So you have to download the app again which means I, at least, will be deleting the account. Because I don’t have room and don’t like this hostage sorta situation.
